title: Calories in 5 Eggs
meta_description: Discover calories in 5 eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per egg, and simple tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), hard-boiled, no added salt, oil, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, brand, freshness, and preparation method. Check packaging or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Five large hard-boiled eggs provide ~390 kcal and ~31.5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison with labels.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tsp oil per egg
Scrambled with 1 tsp butter per egg

faqs.q: How many calories in one egg?
faqs.a: About 78 kcal for one large hard-boiled egg.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 5 eggs?
Do eggs have a lot of cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, five large eggs contain ~930 mg cholesterol, mostly in the yolks.
Around 590 kcal if fried in 1 tsp oil per egg, adding fat.

faqs.q: How does egg size affect calories in 5 eggs?
faqs.a: Smaller eggs lower totals (e.g., ~300 kcal for medium); jumbo raise them (~480 kcal).
